posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that discussion functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

The way I understand the rules for discussion, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for discussion are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to discussion make it much more balanced compared to before.

When DMing, I like to use discussion as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

I've been playing a Half-Orc Paladin in my campaign, and I've noticed that discussion really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about discussion. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with discussion that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
